Hi Noah,
=C2=A0
The file I attached, contains the first 5000 lines of singl=
e arc record i.e. the record=C2=A0is related to=C2=A0http://gate.ac.uk/sale=
/tao/ tao.pdf
=C2=A0
If I closely look at the contents then I can see two d=
ifferent things
=C2=A0
1.=C2=A0Proper English data

=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0
%PDF=
-1.4
%=D1=94=C6=98
1 0 obj
<< /S /GoTo /D (part.1) >>
endobj
4 0 obj
(I GAT=
E Basics)=C2=A0=C2=A0endobj
5 0 obj
<< /S /GoTo /D (chapter.1) >>
endobj
=
=C2=A0
=C2=A0
2. Majority of the data in junk form as below
=C2=A0
=C2=A0
=
=C2=A0obj <<
=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0/Length 833=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=
=A0=C2=A0 
=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0/Filter /FlateDecode
=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=
=C2=A0>>
=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0stream
=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0x=DA=85UMS=
=DB=B0=DE=B3+|=D5=A7=EB=95=9F=D3=BA40a
=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0endstream
=
=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0endobj
=C2=A0
=C2=A0
I am again not sure, if this i=
s because of crawler issue or with the Text editor.
=C2=A0
Please advise on=
 the below points
=C2=A0
1. What is the best text editor to open/view ARC f=
iles
=C2=A0
2. Is WARC format better than ARC when PDF links and other type=
 of binary data require to be=C2=A0crawled?
=C2=A0
Thanks,
Arin
=C2=A0



O=
n Saturday, January 4, 2014 3:57 AM, Noah Levitt <nlevitt@...> wrot=
e:
  
=C2=A0 
Hello Arin,

I don't understand what you're saying the proble=
m is.

The arc file excerpt you attached has less than 1 full record (not 5=
k). But the part of the record it has looks ok to me.

Why not use warc by =
the way?

Noah



On Fri, Jan 3, 2014 at 6:57 AM, Arin Patel Itha <iarinpat=
el@...> wrote:


>
>
>All,
>My requirement is to crawl over PDF links=
 that are available in a seed.
>Seed: http://gate.ac.uk/sale/tao/ 
>I am ex=
pecting crawler to fetch the content from http://gate.ac.uk/sale/tao/tao.pd=
f . But the data that is downloaded in Arc file appears to be not in englis=
h. 
>
>
>The Arc file with the first 5K records is attached for review.
>
>=

>In the=C2=A0begining of the file, Table of Contents of the PDF is display=
ed properly. However, this is displayed along with lots of other text which=
 is normally does not appear in PDF.
>
>
>Any assistance in this regard is =
much appreciated.
>
>Thanks, 
>Arin. 
>
>
